Length of program.description: A two-year degree program with flexible completion timelines based on student's background.

timelines.condition: For students with a pre-professional BAS from Waterloo or equivalent
For all other students with a pre-professional Architecture degree
timelines.notes: Requires two terms of transitional coursework.

Accreditation.notes: The MArch in conjunction with the pre-professional Bachelor of Architectural Studies (BAS) constitutes an accredited professional education.

Admission requirements.required_degree: A four-year, honours pre-professional undergraduate Architecture degree or professional Bachelor of Architecture degree.
additional_requirements: Supplementary information form (including statement of proposed research interest)
Admission requirements.english_proficiency_notes: May be required for applicants without three or more years of post-secondary work at a Canadian institution or where English was not the language of instruction.

Degree requirements.general_notes: The Master of Architecture curriculum covers six key areas: Design; History; Theory; Building Technology; Media and Methods; Professional Practice.

notes: ARCH 6XX represents an open graduate elective.
Students are encouraged to use elective courses to explore areas of specialization.
Up to 1 half credit (0.50) elective may be taken in other departments.
1 half credit (0.50) course may be an independent Reading Course.

milestone_requirements.name: Master's Thesis in Design
milestone_requirements.description: Students must undertake and complete a research and design thesis. The thesis is developed within ARCH 692 and ARCH 693 and completed within the spring term. It must be presented and defended successfully.

milestone_requirements.name: Graduate Studies Work Report
milestone_requirements.description: Implicit requirement of the co-operative program.

milestone_requirements.name: Master's Thesis in Design
milestone_requirements.description: Students must undertake and complete a research and design thesis (in Year 2: Spring). The thesis is developed within ARCH 692 and ARCH 693 and completed within the spring term. It must be presented and defended successfully before an Examining Committee.

Length of program.description: A two-year degree program with flexible completion timelines based on student's background.

timelines.condition: For students with a pre-professional BAS from Waterloo or equivalent
For all other students with a pre-professional Architecture degree
timelines.notes: Requires two terms of transitional coursework.

Accreditation.notes: The MArch in conjunction with the pre-professional Bachelor of Architectural Studies (BAS) constitutes an accredited professional education.

Admission requirements.required_degree: A four-year, honours pre-professional undergraduate Architecture degree or professional Bachelor of Architecture degree.
additional_requirements: Supplementary information form (including statement of proposed research interest)
Admission requirements.english_proficiency_notes: May be required for applicants without three or more years of post-secondary work at a Canadian institution or where English was not the language of instruction.

Degree requirements.general_notes: Students must complete the course and milestone requirements listed below in addition to the Graduate Academic Integrity Module (Graduate AIM).

course_requirements.description: Students must complete the following courses in addition to 2 Water core courses:
notes: ARCH 6XX represents an open graduate elective.
Students are encouraged to use elective courses to explore areas of specialization in support of their thesis research.
1 half credit (0.50) may be an independent Reading Course.
Up to 1 half credit (0.50) elective may be taken in other departments.
1 half WATER credit (0.50) can be counted to fulfill 1 half (0.50) MArch elective requirement.

milestone_requirements.name: Collaborative Research Seminar I
milestone_requirements.description: Students are required to present a seminar on their thesis or major paper research proposal and, if appropriate, early stage results to current and past Water students and Water Institute faculty members. Seminars will normally occur following the completion of WATER 601 and WATER 602.

milestone_requirements.name: Master's Thesis in Design
milestone_requirements.description: Students must undertake and complete a research and design thesis (in Year 2: Spring). The thesis is developed within ARCH 692 and ARCH 693 and completed within the spring term. It must be presented and defended successfully before an Examining Committee.

program_name: Master of Applied Science (MASc) in Biomedical Engineering

Length of program.description: Students are required to complete the program in accordance with the University program time limits.

Graduate research fields: Biomaterials, Tissue Engineering, and Drug Delivery

Admission requirements.required_degree: A bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in any field of engineering or a related science discipline.

references.notes: Applicants who completed their degree five or more years before the application date may submit 1 academic and 1 professional reference.

Admission requirements.notes: Applicants who are deemed to have an inadequate depth of technical BME background may be directed to take additional foundational courses, to be specified at the time of admission.

Degree requirements.general_notes: Students must complete the course and milestone requirements listed below in addition to the Graduate Academic Integrity Module (Graduate AIM).

course_requirements.description: Students must complete the following 4 graduate level courses (0.50 unit weight per course) counting towards degree credit.

field_specific_courses.field: Biomaterials, Tissue Engineering and Drug Delivery

notes: One of the four courses shall be taken from outside the Faculty of Engineering.
All courses must be completed by the end of term 4.
All course selections are arranged by the supervisor(s) in consultation with the student and are subject to the approval of the Director or Associate Director, BME graduate program.
These requirements are in addition to satisfactory completion of any transitional courses that may be specified at the time of admission.
The Faculty of Engineering requires that no more than one-half of the courses used for credit toward a graduate degree may be taught by a candidate’s supervisor(s).

milestone_requirements.name: Professional Attributes and Competence Enhancement (PACE) Module

components.name: Seminar series including presenting a research seminar
components.description: Biweekly seminar series with students and internal and external BME speakers. Each student must attend a minimum of five seminars per term, except for their final term. Each student will be required to present a research seminar by the end of their final term.

components.name: PACE Days
components.description: Students are required to attend and participate in 2 PACE days at the beginning of terms 1, 2, and 3.

components.name: Annual BME Research Day
components.description: Students are required to attend and present at the Annual BME Research Day.

milestone_requirements.name: Master’s Thesis Proposal
milestone_requirements.description: Students must develop and defend a thesis proposal that will be examined and approved by their supervisor and committee. The thesis proposal must be completed by the end of term 3.

milestone_requirements.name: Master’s Thesis
milestone_requirements.description: Upon approval of the thesis proposal, students will proceed to the research and writing of the thesis. Students must complete and orally defend the thesis by the end of term 6. The thesis and defence will be evaluated by the student’s Advisory Committee.
